page.title: 18ECOLOGY OF THE SOUTH CLIFFS
page.content: variety of small mammals,the most common being rabbits and brown rats. Large numbers of mice,voles and shrews can be found and predators are present in the form of stoats.Birds are the most common forms of wildlife to be seen on the cliffs.Apart from hawks,there are many types of gulls, including Herring,Great Black-backed and Lesser Black-backed Gulls,the latter two being common on the cliffs in Summer but prefering to nest elsewhere,as is true of the Puffin, Razorbill and Guilleimot which often choose the small islets off the coast to rear their young.The Black-headed Gull can be seen at the end of its breeding season.Shags and Cormorants are sometimes seen on exposed rocks. The more numerous Shags breed on cliff ledges.Fulmars,Carrion Crows, Ravens and Rock Pipits are also common.
